name: Don't Let The Samba Die
description:
This memory game was made in 72 hours during the Ludum Dare 46 Game Jam. The name is a translation of a famous Brazilian song, and since the theme of the Game Jam was Keep It Alive, we were able to make an inside joke—and a little pun.

The game takes place at a samba, and you (the player) have to move across the party, following and repeating the light sequences as far as you can. 

 DLTSD was made in a group of four people, and I (Pedro) was responsible for the game design, coding, and leading the group.
